page.title: 07THE PILSLEY-HARDWICK RUN
page.content: The 'Historic' Hardwick Hall six-mile road race is organised by local runner Cyril Leason. It has taken place annually since 1981. The first race was won by Bob Foster of Milton Keynes A.C. in 34m 54s. It has been won each year since then by Nick Lees of Derby & County A.C. and his current record time, set on 18th July 1985, stands at 31m 21s. The Ladies' record was set on the same date by Kay Barringham of Hallamshire Harriers H.A.C. with a time of 37m 4s. Both record holders are national runners. Former Great Britain international Keith Angus of Sheffield A.C. holds the Veteran Men's (over 40) section record with a time of 33m 28s also set in 1985. The course goes from Pilsley School to Hardwick Hall and back. 123 athletes took part in the 1985 race.
